programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos contemplates whether aliens that once visited Earth deliberately left a series of clues that mankind was eventually meant to decipher. programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie gets a taste of Cuba in Miami's fresh seafood, sets his sights at a shooting range, and heads cross-state to attempt a huge surf & turf challenge created just for him.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part special in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take three used, V8-engined sports cars on a gruelling road trip covering 1,600 miles through Patagonia to the world's southernmost city. Having encountered stunning landscapes, mechanical mishaps and dreadful roads on their journey through Argentina, the trio's adventure is brought to a dramatic climax by a terrifying turn of events.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve Backshall leads a team into Yucatan, Mexico on the trail of the ancient Maya. Uncovering sinister secrets and artefacts, they push far into the underworld of the Maya.

programme.title: Hook (1991)
programme.desc: Peter Pan, who has finally grown up and is now a married lawyer with a family of his own, is whisked away by Tinkerbell to Neverland, where he must learn to fly again if he is to save his children from the clutches of Captain Hook. Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure, with Robin Williams, Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines how the car industry in Germany and Japan blossomed following the Second World War, becoming manufacturing giants that far outstripped the Allied nations that had defeated them. He test drives some of the vehicles Germany and Japan produced during the post-war period, as well as an assortment of other classic cars, including E-Types and Mustangs. He also reveals the sad tale of the Austin Allegro, a vehicle that had a devastating impact on the British car industry.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James charts the history of 4x4 vehicles from the jeeps of the Second World war onwards, revealing how they rose in popularity in everyday use and in rallies. He explores the rivalry between Land Rover and Land Cruiser, and puts some classic vehicles through their paces by driving up Mount Fuji and through the Mojave desert.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James looks at some of the advances in motoring that never caught on, revealing how the petrol engine came to dominate in the 20th century, while concepts for jet engines and steam power fell by the wayside. He also drives an amphibious car and an electric scooter, and takes a ride in the world's fastest driverless car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team sets off on a high-altitude trek from Kathmandu, capital of Nepal, to the Forbidden City of Lo Manthang, a secretive kingdom perched high on the Tibetan plateau, on the far side of the Himalayas. On a five-day expedition through the highest mountains, deepest gorges and harshest terrain on the planet, Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris battle huge river crossings, vast mudslides and dizzying mountain passes on a trip that would test even the hardiest new 4x4s to the limit. But Paddy, Freddie and Chris aren't crossing the Himalayas in new 4x4s. They're crossing the Himalayas in a small old Peugeot, a very compact old Renault, and Nepal's first (and only) home-built car.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Actor Mackenzie Crook, wildlife presenter Chris Packham, writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell and comedian Rhod Gilbert join David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with odd personal statements that may or may not be true.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines the social significance of cars in the 20th century. He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake journeys on some of the most perilous routes in the world. In Alaska, Sue Perkins and Charley Boorman drive along the notorious Dalton Highway, a dirt track originally constructed in the 1970s as a supply road for the Trans-Alaska oil pipeline. The pair struggle to cope with the Arctic conditions and constant threat of avalanches, but receive help from experienced truckers who teach them some unwritten rules for surviving the road's many hazards.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert and Greg Davies negotiate a variety of unusual hazards as they travel through Nepal, a country with one of the world's highest rates of road traffic accidents. Frequent floods and landslides mean car journeys are often fraught with danger, and matters are not helped by the varied states of Nepalese roads, which range from urban highways to crumbling mountain passes.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Hugh Dennis undertake a perilous journey through the Peruvian Andes. Their route takes in 2,000ft drops, one-lane dirt roads, remote mountain trails and muddy, humid jungle terrain, as they search for the lost city of Constitucion, once destined to be the capital of Peru.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to Norway to find out how a selection of cars fare when taking part in Winter Olympic events. programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake some of the most perilous journeys in the world. Comedians Ed Byrne and Andy Parsons drive along Siberia's M56 Kolyma highway, known as the 'Road of Bones'. Along the way, they brave sub-zero temperatures, traverse icy routes, encounter deserted gulags and meet the locals who inhabit the frozen wilderness, but despite picking up practical tips for survival, the duo feel they are out of their depth.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Broadcasters Sue Perkins and Liza Tarbuck drive along the Ho Chi Minh Trail, a network of roads and paths in Southeast Asia that was littered with unexploded bombs following the Vietnam War. Their journey takes them through jungles and mountains to some of the least-explored corners of Laos and Vietnam, and proves to be a gruelling test of their bravery, motoring skills and senses of humour.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and David Baddiel travel along more than 1,200 miles of hazardous roads in Ethiopia on a journey to Aksum, the country's holiest place. However, they have to contend with more than fatigue and unreliable terrain to reach their destination, as they encounter drug-taking truck drivers, suffer a disastrous breakdown and start to run out of fuel at the worst possible time.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond compete in a land race from Resolute, Canada, to the North Pole in their most ambitious challenge to date. Pitting horse power against dog power they travel 450 miles across mountainous land masses and jagged sea ice at temperatures as low as minus 65C.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are challenged to build a bridge over the River Kwai in Thailand. In order to do that, however, they have to drive across Burma, a country that has been largely closed to Westerners for more than 40 years, and must make the trip in three lorries, each bought sight unseen from the internet on a limited budget. What follows is an epic journey of beautiful scenery, regular adversity, ongoing malfunction and the constant bickering of the three men.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner returns with the light-hearted panel show in which three celebrities argue the case for having their pet hates banished for ever to the fictional room. In the opening show, the big names with an even bigger axe to grind are one-time Doctor Who and Broadchurch star David Tennant, veteran broadcaster Trevor McDonald, and actress, writer and comedian Aisling Bea. Sushi, flossing, pigeons, lateness and queuing are just some of the things that get this trio's backs up - but who will Frank decide has made the most persuasive argument?.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian Noel Fielding, footballer-turned-presenter Ian Wright and actress Joanna Scanlan reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include spiders, stinky cheese, hangovers and bad toast etiquette.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Model Katie Price, comedian Greg Davies and Citizen Khan star Adil Ray tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include friends who give their dog specific instructions and talentless people on talent shows.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Charlie's school gets a bad Ofsted rating, Lee and Lucy start looking around for alternative schools. Despite Frank's protests, Geoffrey and Wendy offer to pay to send Charlie to be privately educated, which presents Lee and Lucy with a moral dilemma.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee interrupts Lucy's favourite TV programme by plonking himself down next to her on the sofa, eating her chocolates and talking loudly all the way through the dialogue. But when he suddenly can't remember the name of the leading actor and his hypochondria tells him he is losing his memory, Lucy's evening is completely ruined.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Unable to convince Lucy that he did not smash a blue and white antique vase that belonged to her grandmother, Lee summons the family to a meeting to flush out the culprit.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The posse meet three cat clerics who worship Lister. Lister vows to help them as they're being hunted by a feral cat leader who wants to wipe out cats who worship anyone but him. Ray Fearon joins the regular cast as the ruthless Rodon, leader of the feral cats, with Tom Bennett, Mandeep Dhillon and Lucy Pearman as the cat clerics.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and a series of mischievous games, Dave invites three of the country's finest comic minds to help him make sense of our insensible world. In the first episode he is joined by Richard Osman, Phil Wang and Sara Barron, as they take a deep dive into the details we usually miss.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actress and comedy writer Jennifer Saunders takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with artist Grayson Perry and stand-up Matt Forde joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel show, in which correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, in favour of answers the host finds most interesting. This time, Sandi Toksvig, Aisling Bea, Susan Calman and regular panellist Alan Davies navigate the topic of mathematics.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis front a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring best bits and unseen material from the series.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle attempt to come up with a next level surfboard to add to the Hawaiian's history book.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Chinese authorities attempt a huge infrastructure project as they try to move vast amounts of water from the wet south of the country to the dry north.

programme.title: Jim Clark: The Quiet Champion
programme.desc: Profile of the two-time Formula One champion, who was killed at the height of his career. Featuring rare archive footage from family home-movies, candid interviews with the driver himself and comments by close friends, including Jackie Stewart, who reminisces about their time spent together racing when they were known as Batman and Robin.

programme.title: Graham Hill: Driven
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of motor racing star Graham Hill, who became the only man to win the Formula One World Championship, Indianapolis 500 and Le Mans 24-hour race - but whose reckless streak was to prove his undoing. Among those sharing their memories of the charismatic Englishman are his son Damon - who became Formula One world champion himself in 1996 - and Jackie Stewart.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The documentary uncovering the hidden history of Britain continues with the story of the department store Selfridges, looking at the ways it changed the country's shopping habits. Plus, an examination of the life of Mr Selfridge himself.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: British troops save Edith and Rene from execution, and the pair are released into the woods. Meanwhile, the Germans decide to head for Spain, and Michelle joins Crabtree in a duet. Classic wartime sitcom, starring Gorden Kaye and Carmen Silvera.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The Colonel and Gruber's escape plan has gone awry, so they try to make general Von Klinkerhoffen believe the Resistance had kidnapped them.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene is imprisoned by communist leader Louise, who plans to use him as her love slave, while Mimi, Edith and Yvette are convinced he is dead and decide to hold a seance.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that 'goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications'.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: A former dealer is selling his entire medal collection - will Dave and Steve find anything worth bidding for? And Steve digs deep into a WW1 army medic's family history.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: At St Athan in Wales, engineer John Sparks and his team of ex-Navy and RAF engineers begin the task of reassembling the Czech-built jet from nine parts delivered by lorry.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's â€˜Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the world's grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazil's giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wild animals that have made a home in cities, including leopards on the streets of Mumbai, peregrine falcons hunting among New York's skyscrapers, hyenas that live peacefully alongside the people of Harar, macaques in Jaipur, and langurs in Jodhpur, which are regarded as having great religious significance by the citizens. The programme also examines how some animals are struggling to survive in urban environments, and questions how cities can be built to serve their needs as well as those of the human inhabitants.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that 'goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications'.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's washing-machine breaks down, and Arkwright decides to try and lure her into his home with the offer of his vintage machine.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville struggles to find some privacy when the milkwoman makes a pass at him. Nurse Gladys Emmanuel steps in by persuading Arkwright to take her to a hotel.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: Fig Biscuits and Inspirational Toilet Rolls
programme.desc: Arkwright decides to open the shop before dawn to catch the morning rush and tries a special promotion to get rid of some of the goods, including fig biscuits and toilet rolls.

programme.title: Jackie Stewart the Flying Scot
programme.desc: Profile of the legendary racing driver, tracing his early career and influence on Formula One.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Henri Landru, who targeted lonely and vulnerable women during the First World War. He seduced them with promises of marriage and lured them to houses outside Paris where the women vanished. With the police uninterested in investigating the disappearances, two women took it upon themselves to pursue Landru.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The bravery of the 333rd Field Artillery Battalion, a depleted unit of African-American soldiers who risked everything to fight off the Nazis at Bastogne, Belgium.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Concrete channels hidden in a mountaintop forest, a collapsing bridge, a marooned military base and the upright rusting carcass of ship.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Broadcaster Chris Tarrant continues his travels along the world's most challenging railways. Here he attempts to cross the Andes, setting off from the coast of Chile and heading for the Bolivian capital of Sucre. Along the way he traverses some of the driest and most inhospitable environments on the planet, hitches rides on unusual trains and deals with altitude sickness at more than 3,000 metres.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the wildlife eking out an existence in and around the scorching wilderness of the Sahara, where only the toughest survive. It's a constant struggle against dehydration, as zebra battle over dwindling rivers, camels search for water and tiny barn swallows navigate thousands of square miles of barren sand to find a life-saving oasis. The naked mole rat avoids the heat by living a subterranean existence, while the silver ant is able to take on the midday sun - but needs a 'spacesuit' to do it.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Robert Laycock who rallied his ill-equipped troops to see off a German attack on Crete, Greece.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable to attacks.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: The team acquire a personalised Victorian pistol and try to track down the original owner. A customer brings in brasses that his dad brought back from the Somme.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Herbert Rowse Armstrong, who was convicted of murdering his wife with arsenic. Much of the evidence against him was circumstantial and the scientific testimony remains disputed. This episode examines both sides of the case and asks whether the British justice system made a terrible mistake.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Robert Laycock who rallied his ill-equipped troops to see off a German attack on Crete, Greece.

programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A towering structure with an explosive past, a deserted cityscape, a mysterious top-secret facility and a vast Nazi construction.

programme.title: Planet Earth II

A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chris Tarrant on the Polar Express
programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. This is an epic 2,000-mile adventure from Moscow into Arctic Siberia, and begins with a marathon 19-hour leg. Along the way he enjoys a reindeer stew with a local family and takes the controls of one of the massive locomotives that power the trains, before pressing on along railways built under the brutal regime of Joseph Stalin.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: How Field Marshall Erich von Manstein's escape from the Red Army influenced Nato's defence plans.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An American prison for the violent and deranged with links to an infamous cult leader, and a cavernous tunnel network in France offering shelter from unrelenting bombardment.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Falkirk wheel is the first and only rotating boat lift, capable of moving 600 tonnes of boat and water over a 25-metre height difference in just minutes.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund Blackadder, conniving courtier to Elizabeth I, takes in a spirited lad as his manservant - unaware the fellow is actually a woman out to make her fortune. Classic comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Miranda Richardson and Stephen Fry, with a guest appearance by Rik Mayall as Edmund's best friend Lord Flashheart.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund is appointed Lord High Executioner and moves a beheading forward from Wednesday to Monday so he and his staff can enjoy some time off. Unfortunately, he didn't take into account the Queen's tendency to change her mind. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Miranda Richardson.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund becomes jealous of the adulation that a boastful Sir Walter Raleigh has been receiving in court since his return from the New World. Attempting to impress the queen, he announces his intention to go on a voyage around the Cape of Good Hope, but his choice of captain leaves a lot to be desired. Comedy, guest starring Tom Baker and Simon Jones, with Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Revisiting the killing of brilliant but controversial young playwright Christopher Marlowe, who was stabbed to death in a Deptford lodging house in 1593.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: King Edward II: A Mysterious Death
programme.desc: The controversy surrounding the death of Edward II, whose forced abdication preceded his mysterious demise while in custody.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Amelia Dyer, who promised mothers that for a fee she would adopt their babies and raise them as her own. In fact, she neglected and murdered countless infants over a 30-year period in Victorian Britain. This episode tells the story of Dyer and of Evelina Marmon, one of the desperate young mothers she deceived.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: How Field Marshall Erich von Manstein's escape from the Red Army influenced Nato's defence plans.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A devastated cliff-top ruin, an extraordinarily tall tower, a concrete structure stranded at sea and a heavy metal monster in a field all feature.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. This proves to be a major challenge given the unreliability of the service and the old trains regularly used, but makes for a fascinating journey to Chris's ultimate goal, the American naval base at Guantanamo Bay. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of the siege of Kohima in 1944, when heavily outnumbered British and Indian troops held off Japanese forces until reinforcements could arrive.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An Albanian village home to Allied secret agents, devastated for resisting the Nazi war machine, and a notorious asylum in America that enforced lobotomies.

programme.title: The Story of Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The making of the sitcom, beginning with a look at the relationship between the Trotter brothers and how the series became a fixture of the BBC's Christmas schedules.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund Blackadder, conniving courtier to Elizabeth I, takes in a spirited lad as his manservant - unaware the fellow is actually a woman out to make her fortune. programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Juan Borgia: A Death in the Dynasty
programme.desc: The infamous Borgia family was devastated when favourite son Juan was murdered in 1497. Here, modern experts set about cracking the case and fingering the killer.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The unsolved murders committed by the Butcher of Kingsbury Run, a serial killer operating in Cleveland, Ohio, in the 1930s. The Butcher killed at least 12 men and women, dismembering their bodies and scattering them across the city.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of the siege of Kohima in 1944, when heavily outnumbered British and Indian troops held off Japanese forces until reinforcements could arrive.

programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Hidden tunnels that saw a city prosper, a sunken wreck with a remarkable past, a concrete wartime dome and a mysterious Cold War building.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the world's grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazil's giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Roy Urquhart, who successfully evaded the enemy in his retreat across the Rhine after leading British troops into a doomed attack at Arnhem.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Eye-witness veteran testimony from men who served under fire on the frontline, taking viewers to the heart of iconic moments in the history of warfare. The first episode looks at the Allied invasion of Europe, which began on June 6 1944 - D-Day. British, American and Canadian troops stormed the beaches of Normandy in what would become known as The Longest Day.

programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Third Reich: The Search for Hitler's Bomb
programme.desc: Part two of two. A look at Nazi experiments into atomic weapons, examining how close they got to developing a functioning nuclear device before the end of the war.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Amy Dudley: The Queen, Her Lover, and His Wife
programme.desc: The suspicious death of Elizabethan noblewoman Amy Dudley, the wife of Robert Dudley, the favourite and alleged lover of Queen Elizabeth I and the man the monarch is said to have wanted to marry - if only he had been available. Amy's body was found at the foot of the stairs at Cumnor Place, her home in Oxfordshire in 1560, and her death caused a scandal - with the finger of blame pointed firmly at Dudley.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: The Princes in The Tower: Royal Blood
programme.desc: Examining the case of the princes in the tower, and questioning whether or not Richard III ordered their deaths.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The German police's attempts to catch a depraved and psychotic killer, who struck fear into women travelling on Berlin's S-Bahn train network during the Second World War.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1970s Bond Bug three-wheeler divides opinion among Mathewsons customers, while a retired engineer reluctantly auctions off his late father's treasured 60s Jaguar Mark 2.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the region's islands, which are home to a vast array of extraordinary wildlife. The programme reveals how remote human communities native to the area are surrounded by harsh terrain and subjected to extreme weather conditions. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: A look at how the 20,000 islands in the region became colonised by humans and animals. For the Polynesians, the Pacific's first people, their journeys constituted a feat of navigational ingenuity, while animals often had to rely on violent forces of nature, such as cyclones and tsunamis, to reach the shores.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the marine wildlife of the region. Included are the epic journeys of sperm whales from one side of the ocean to the other in search of food and a mate, the thriving species that inhabit New Zealand's coast, and the tropical penguins and sea lions supported by the Galapagos Islands.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe narrates the first of three special editions of the archive music show focusing on 1960s hits, beginning with tracks by artists including the Foundations, Julie Driscoll, Sandie Shaw and Procol Harum.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Another selection of performances from the archives, focusing on hits of the 1960s. Featured artists include Clodagh Rodgers, the Move, Tom Jones and the Bee Gees, plus more from Top of the Pops and other shows from the era. Narrated by Mark Radcliffe.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Lynda La Plante's crime drama. DI Pat North investigates the case of a woman abducted in broad daylight, but a sudden murder confession leaves the squad with more questions than answers. Meanwhile, DCS Michael Walker begins to fear for his children's safety at the hands of his ex-wife's new boyfriend. Kate Buffery and David Hayman star.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. The roguish antiques dealer finds a Scottish gothic temple brings him closer to Lady Jane, while love is in the air for Eric. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Tony tries to help Jacko forget Julie by taking him on a double date, while Jessica exposes corruption in high places. The McCleods hear the patter of tiny feet and recent events finally take their toll on Mark, who makes an inspection of the barracks go with something of a bang.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Drysdale decides to send the boys on an escort mission to Africa, but it proves to be a fiasco on every level - particularly for Jeremy, who first refuses to follow the CO's orders to the letter, then has a bitter reunion with ex-wife Lilian that sets the sparks flying. Mark also resurfaces, as a mercenary soldier fighting for the enemy and keen to gain revenge on his former King's Own colleagues.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: One Step Too Far - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Laura looks at Gabriel with new eyes when he takes a surprisingly compassionate approach to her wayward son Liam, who is being bullied because of her job. Adam tries to mend fences with the rank-and-file officers by going out on the beat with June - only to lose his cool completely when a traffic accident triggers painful memories. Samantha jeopardises Jo's investigation by poaching her informant, leading to a bitter row, while Gary's future on the force looks uncertain after he reacts to Suzie's constant needling with a very public outburst.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane is assigned to work with Nick, and when they find a cocaine package inside a patient, the duo end up lying to Ric and the police. Sam tries to set up Joseph with a new nurse, but he is not interested. Ryan resurfaces, and Mark tries to persuade him to turn himself in, but the terrified teenager lashes out and stabs Matt. Patsy Byrne guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The staff get into the spirit of Halloween and Adam begins his first shift as a nurse in A&E. A sombre Eve, shaken after treating a drug overdose patient, makes a life-changing decision. Chloe gets into another argument with Tina - and reveals she is having an abortion the very next day. Hospital drama, starring Cathy Shipton, Barbara Marten, Claire Goose and Rebecca Wheatley.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: One Step Too Far - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Laura begins to feel increasingly unfulfilled in her role as PCSO, and announces to Smithy that she wants to become a PC. Gina's old flame Jonathan Fox returns to Sun Hill, and Neil pressures Gary to drop his bullying accusations against Susie Sim. Gabriel warns an increasingly infatuated Sheelagh not to get involved with him, while Samantha continues to needle Jo, fuelling an already volatile situation.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil takes Hattie down to Southampton to look for Steve and while there meets a Romanian girl who has just come over to England. Hattie finds Steve but is unable to change his mind.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The raft race takes place but George is called away when Kelly goes into labour. Meanwhile, Ariadne has news for Nick and Sicknote's secret is revealed.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie tries to keep Paul's revelation that he is Hector's son a secret, hoping to protect Molly. But Lexie is determined they should face up to the reality of the situation sooner rather than later and persuades Paul to stay at Glenbogle until the dust has settled.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: While attending a conference, David receives a job offer that seems impossible to refuse _ will he leave Simon in the lurch? Karen anxiously prepares to meet her estranged mother for lunch, and Chris learns the truth about Beth's marital status. Anna treats a man whose health is suffering due to his job in a textile factory, but ends up equally concerned about his wife's welfare as she struggles to look after her husband and two lazy teenagers. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell reports Freddie's disappearance - as Jack and Leonora discover that somebody else is looking for him.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted falls in love with a piano-playing guest at the holiday camp, but romance proves difficult with her overbearing mother in the way. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean ponders giving up work and handing the company over to Judith and Sandy - much to Lionel's delight. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Changing Face of Rural Blamire
programme.desc: Thinking they have to much free time on their hands, the trio decide to find some kind of occupation. They encounter a dodgy bankrupted dealer who persuades them to sell his new product - with disastrous results, particularly for Blamire. Michael Bates, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Jo Mills is persuaded to act on behalf of a drug addict, who went on the run 16 years previously after being charged with attempted murder. The defendant alleges detectives forced him to sign a confession and allowed him to escape custody - leaving Deed to decide if they should be charged with perverting the course of justice. Starring Martin Shaw, Donald Sinden, Jenny Seagrove, Caroline Langrishe and Robert Cavanah.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The gun used to kill a boxer is discovered at the scene of an armed robbery 15 years later, prompting the team to reinvestigate the case. Twenty-one-year-old Eddie Mayfair was shot dead a week after winning an important bout, which left his opponent seriously injured and unable to carry on his career. The detectives initially suspect revenge as a motive, but the case is complicated when they uncover the rivalries and money-making aspects of the sport. Guest starring Maggie O'Neill (Shameless) and Chloe Howman (Casualty).

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The discovery of human remains in an urban canal is linked to the unsolved murder of a prison governor 15 years earlier, leading the team to seek out the original suspects. However, it is not long before the prison psychologist, who is married to the victim's daughter, finds himself personally embroiled in the investigation. Meanwhile, Boyd launches a search for his son Luke.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: One Step Too Far - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Laura begins to feel increasingly unfulfilled in her role as PCSO, and announces to Smithy that she wants to become a PC. Gina's old flame Jonathan Fox returns to Sun Hill, and Neil pressures Gary to drop his bullying accusations against Susie Sim. Gabriel warns an increasingly infatuated Sheelagh not to get involved with him, while Samantha continues to needle Jo, fuelling an already volatile situation.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The raft race takes place but George is called away when Kelly goes into labour. Meanwhile, Ariadne has news for Nick and Sicknote's secret is revealed.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Tony is hauled over the coals for smuggling rifles into Britain, and Fitzpatrick blows his top on the eve of McCleod's funeral, angry that disillusioned widow Angela is not allowing it to be done with full military honours.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Drysdale's superiors blame him for McCleod's death, Fitzpatrick is turned down for promotion, and Andy's attempt to prove himself gets Jacko into trouble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: One Step Too Far - Part Two

Gabriel warns an increasingly infatuated Sheelagh not to get involved with him, while Samantha continues to needle Jo, fuelling an already volatile situation.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Nick adopts unconventional methods to treat an ulcer, and Jac accuses him of putting the patient's life on the line to further his own career. Sam questions a diagnosis made by Connie, so she bans him from theatre - but it turns out he could be in the right. Kyla is accused by Chrissie of being unprofessional, and responds by threatening to report Donna for being asleep on the job.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A visiting TV documentary crew filming a day in the life of a Holby paramedic are treated to a hectic day involving a major accident on a building site and an embarrassing predicament for two countryside canoodlers. Medical drama, starring Ian Bleasdale, Claire Goose and Rebecca Wheatley.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Zain Nadir searches for a missing 14-year-old whose online romance has led her into danger, and a guilt-stricken Gabriel reveals to Sheelagh that he deliberately killed the Sun Hill sniper by pushing him from a rooftop. Meanwhile, Honey returns to work after the shock suicide of murderous husband Scott, and finds herself paired with arch-enemy Amber Johannsen. True to form, it isn't long before they come to blows.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Hattie and Steve part on bad terms but Clyde finds there's something she hasn't told Steve. Phil has an idea to secure Nadia's security in the UK.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: There is tension in the Tavenier household as two secrets are unveiled. Michelle and Hattie have a heart to heart, and Phil asks a favour from Clyde and Nigel.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A brigade directive to stamp out facial hair is introduced,. Meanwhile, a group of thugs hijack a bus, leading to a city centre red alert.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie considers leaving the estate, tempted by the opportunity to run a New York restaurant, Lexie takes on Lord Kilwillie's scheming sister Dorothy, while Andrew and Golly come to Molly's rescue when she is swindled out of an antique table by a local dealer. Highland drama, starring Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A memorial service for Peggy brings memories of happy times flooding back to her family and friends. Vic puts on a brave face, while Lucy's poignant speech brings a tear to everyone's eye. Anna becomes increasingly worried about depressed widower Ted, and following a hunch, heads to the factory to find him perched on the roof _ ready to jump. Dick and Oscar are surprised by Cheryl's return and a heartfelt confession provides an important breakthrough in their bid to be happily united.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie has her cards read to help find out where Freddie is, while the rest of the family check out a country mansion.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Peggy's piano skills upset Ted's delicate musical ear, so he challenges the royal marines to race over their assault course. Comedy, starring Paul Shane, Kenneth Connor and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy has relationship problems and Jean frets when Judith starts dating a married man. At a dinner party attended by Penny and Stephen, Lionel has to steer the conversation away from personal matters. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wally Batty threatens to leave home, and Compo seizes the opportunity to move in with Nora by dressing smartly and even considering taking a bath to impress her.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Bacchus and Gently hunt for the murderer of a woman whose body is discovered in a local church. As the investigation progresses, it turns out the victim was a waitress working at the first hostess club in Newcastle - an establishment that has greatly upset the local religious community. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with guest appearances by Brendan Coyle (Lark Rise to Candleford) and Mark Williams (The Fast Show).

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Retired DI Frank Patterson presents the team with information regarding the getaway car used in a 30-year-old safety deposit-box robbery. They discover the former detective not only wants to convict the suspected thief of the heist and murder of his three colleagues, but also prove that a high-ranking officer was involved in the plot - jeopardising the future of Sandra's Ucos unit. Phil Daniels guest stars.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A dog's grisly discovery in the woods provides the team with a new clue on a two-year-old case concerning a decapitated corpse found near an army base. Following the trail leads the squad to a regimental dinner at the barracks, where a high-level conspiracy is uncovered. Rupert Graves guest stars.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: A woman is perched between the harsh legacy of the Second World War and the hope of a new life in her native Australia. In the first episode, Sarah Adams learns some tragic news, which leads her to decide to return to her home. Romantic drama set during the 1950s, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Olivia is still feeling unwell and disconcerted by James's continued distance, while Elizabeth feels put out by talk at the dinner table, and Sarah tries to separate her social status from the Blighs by putting Roy in between her and the wealthy family.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Zain Nadir searches for a missing 14-year-old whose online romance has led her into danger, and a guilt-stricken Gabriel reveals to Sheelagh that he deliberately killed the Sun Hill sniper by pushing him from a rooftop. programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Matt's parents want him discharged from hospital so she can be treated at home, while Mark blames himself for the stabbing. Donna flirts with a handsome physiotherapist, but Kyla warns her to stay away from him. The treatment of a heart patient causes conflict, as Connie wants to try the pump she helped to develop, but Elliot is adamant a transplant is required.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part one of two. A child with meningitis is rushed into the department, and the new resuscitation room is tested to the limit when an animal rights bomb causes devastation. Meanwhile, Sean has a frustrating time trying to treat a patient with obsessive-compulsive disorder. Starring Derek Thompson, Cathy Shipton and Gerald Kyd.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Zain Nadir discovers Smithy has been canoodling with the wife of notorious local gangster Pete Larson, while arch-rivals Amber and Honey are teamed up yet again, this time to catch a gang defrauding cash machines. June has another bash at warning Sheelagh against getting too involved with Gabriel, and Phil is livid to discover ex-lover Christine is planning on emigrating to Australia - taking their daughter Madison with her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil is getting ready to marry Nadia so she can stay in Britain. Christine is confiding to Kath about her affair with Arthur and Hattie is torn between keeping her baby or abortion.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel plans a special evening and Arthur keeps a low profile. Mark reaches boiling point and Clyde is forced to accept Gidea's plans for the future.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Hallam gets trapped in a burning shopping centre. Meanwhile, Ariadne realises that Nick has not told anybody about their relationship.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Sibling rivalry rears its ugly head when a familiar face returns to Glenbogle with a proposal to build an outdoor activity centre on the estate, prompting Molly to immerse herself in Andrew's company and focus on passing her driving test. Meanwhile, Duncan sees a chance to pay back Archie for accidentally blowing up the house, and Lexie discovers the estate has been burgled. Drama, starring Alastair Mackenzie, Lloyd Owen and Susan Hampshire.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Election fever grips Skelthwaite, but Simon finds his opponent more formidable and devious than the weedy kid he used to bully at school. Karen's mother Linda is becoming a burden at the Buckley home, but a rethink is needed when it emerges she has a serious medical problem, and David finds himself embroiled in Conrad Walker's spurious business empire with no hope of backing out. Meanwhile, Beth uncovers Anita's beauty secrets and plans to make things difficult for estranged husband Stewart.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell has trouble with a neighbour, Billy has a new job and Aveline is offered the chance of a lifetime.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Clive and Gladys cancel their wedding, but it remains to be seen whether April will marry Spike. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.desc: Jean and Lionel's peaceful weekend in the country is disrupted when they find the faithful Mrs Bale is not her usual cheerful self. To add to their woes, Lionel feels unwell - but a visit from a doctor with a strange bedside manner sheds light on their housekeeper's mood.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio hatch a cunning plan to try to persuade a tight-fisted pub-goer to buy a round of drinks at the local.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries

Lynley faces charges of intimidating a suspect, and is suspended from duty, meaning Havers and new partner DI Fiona Knight (guest star Liza Tarbuck) must investigate when the body of a woman is found in a lake. However, the detective involves himself in the case, compromising his chances of an unbiased trial. Crime drama, starring Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. An anonymous e-mail leads the squad to wasteground in east London, where the remains of a right-wing political activist are found. Further research into the man's past reveals he was not who he claimed to be and had a hidden agenda of his own. Detective drama, guest starring Philip Whitchurch and Cyril Nri.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The veteran detectives investigate the murder of a palaeontologist at the Natural History Museum, discovering the victim was a respected but outspoken scientist with a knack for rubbing people up the wrong way. When it comes out he was strongly opposed to the museum's sponsorship deal with a large fuel company, the cops soon have plenty of suspects. Amanda Redman stars, with guest appearances by Trevor Bannister, Lucy Brown and Natasha Little.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah's annoyance at the invasion of her privacy turns to anger when she is questioned by Jack about her real name. She refuses to answer his questions and is unwilling to be drawn into a defence of her character because she feels she is the one who has had her privacy invaded. However, Jack persists in demanding an explanation, causing her to do the one thing he never expected. Australian drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Jack heads out around town with Sarah on her first day at work, but the horrors of the war cast a shadow over Inverness. Meanwhile, Olivia is unable to stop herself from wondering about the woman James admitted to loving in Europe, and makes a shocking discovery. Drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp, Craig Hall, Arianwen Parkes-Lockwood and David Berry.
