programme.desc: Zain Nadir discovers Smithy has been canoodling with the wife of notorious local gangster Pete Larson, while arch-rivals Amber and Honey are teamed up yet again, this time to catch a gang defrauding cash machines. June has another bash at warning Sheelagh against getting too involved with Gabriel, and Phil is livid to discover ex-lover Christine is planning on emigrating to Australia - taking their daughter Madison with her.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Nick performs an unnecessary operation in his campaign for a transfer. However, when the patient's condition worsens, Jac is forced to take matters into her own hands. Matt and Dean undergo a student assessment with Lord Byrne, but may not be up to the challenge. Mark is plagued by his secrets as he treats a woman with problems similar to his own.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part two of two. Amid the chaos of a laboratory bombing, Charlie is shocked to discover a different side to Max and Duffy, an estranged couple are brought together again by their son's critical condition and the team marks Remembrance Day with the customary silence. Starring Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry appears in court to testify against brother Ben, but reacts badly to being questioned about his own childhood abuse, indirectly jeopardising the outcome of the trial. Phil begins to realise he is powerless to stop former lover Christine emigrating with their daughter Madison, while Smithy spends the night with sultry Louise Larson, unaware Zain Nadir is investigating the criminal activities of her husband Pete.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sanjay takes some advice from Richard, and Mark is concerned about Aidan and Mandy. Gidea and Hattie share a problem..

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Hattie helps Clyde, Michelle is worried about Shelley and Mark, Sanjay is in trouble when he lies to Gita and Cindy is irritated by Ian's support of Hattie.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Nick gets hold of the wrong end of the stick, and Blue Watch play a football match against Borough Street. Meanwhile, the team have to rescue a naked man from a burning flat.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Tensions run high between the family and the villagers after Paul decides the Outdoor Activity Centre should cater for disadvantaged teens as well as corporate clients. Meanwhile, Molly starts Glenbogle's first dating agency, which results in two potential romances for Duncan, but threatens her own relationship with Andrew. Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A good-looking newcomer sets hearts a-flutter among the women of Skelthwaite, but behind the handsome exterior lies a troubled mind. Meanwhile, Linda reveals she needs an urgent operation that will cost 10,000 pounds, and son-in-law David vows to get her the money, but may not be entirely truthful about her illness. Drama, starring Leslie Ash, Lesley Dunlop, Tony Haygarth and Lee Warburton.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell is rushed to hospital after a day out with her friend Derek, Grandad receives a visit from Lilo Lill.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted's plan to get Clive and Gladys back together requires a scapegoat - in the form of Peggy. Comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean return from a weekend away to find Judith's boyfriend has been staying at the house. To add to their woes, Alistair announces he has got engaged to a girl named Mercury - dashing their hopes of his ever becoming their son-in-law. Comedy starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Ballad for Wind Instruments and Canoe
programme.desc: The trio stumble across a canoe and decide to take it for an unauthorised trip up the river - but things soon start to go wrong. Meanwhile, Ivy wins a prize for having the best mouth-instrument.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest finds himself embroiled with MI5, which puts Lady Felicia in a compromising position - will she betray her friend to protect secrets from her own past? Drama, starring Mark Williams and Nancy Carroll.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: When Blake is called to investigate the murder of a retired carpenter, his only real suspect is a teenage boy discovered praying over the body and covered in blood.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: DNA tests on a suspected robber prove his innocence but also reveal his father was an unnamed vagrant strangled on a tube train 15 years earlier. The team reopens the case, going in pursuit of the victim's other family members - including the man they believe to be his brother - while Brian questions the homeless community, only to fall foul of a gang of robbers. Peter Davison and Keith Allen guest star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When the body of salesman Chris Dearden is found in a disused tunnel, investigations reveal he had been reported missing by his wife Lucy in 1996. The ritualistic nature of the murder leads the team to suspect a group of middle-aged men who had been on a self-empowerment weekend. However, the victim's son refuses to believe the body is his father's.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The maverick detective finds his career on the line once more when an apparently watertight murder prosecution collapses because of his unconventional interrogation methods. Facing the wrath of the victim's family - not to mention his own colleagues - Rebus digs deeper, but finds himself caught up in a spate of gangland revenge killings. Nicholas Farrell guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Nick gets hold of the wrong end of the stick, and Blue Watch play a football match against Borough Street. Meanwhile, the team have to rescue a naked man from a burning flat.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The Highland GP has a run-in with an old friend and later investigates what appears to be an attack on a gay man, only to find himself caught up in a traumatic domestic violence case. David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie star.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Highland medic Dr Finlay begins to suspect the Reverend Gill may be more interested in the pleasures of this world than the rewards of the next, and sets out to investigate. Meanwhile, his colleague Dr Napier delivers glad tidings to a married woman - but does not receive the joyful response he anticipated. Rural drama, with David Rintoul and Jessica Turner.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A dawn raid by bailiffs leaves the antiques dealer staring ruin in the face, and with nothing left to look forward to, he decides to turn his back on society. With Ian McShane and guest star Alexei Sayle.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dealer recruits con artists Matron Jackie, Gideon and Henry the Hearse Chaser to attend an auction where he is selling a painting, to purposely bid against each other to bump up the price. However, Lady Jane also bids and after discovering the ruse concocts a plan to get her own back and wipe the smile off Lovejoy's face. Charlotte Cornwell guest stars with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Obadiah Hakeswill returns to create more mischief, kidnapping a beautiful aristocrat and undermining the discipline of Wellesley's men. Sharpe is dispatched to thwart his old foe, and manages to inflict a humiliating defeat on French forces in the process - but only at terrible personal loss to himself. Sean Bean, Elizabeth Hurley and Pete Postlethwaite star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Ally's dodgy dealings take a turn for the worse, and Barry has difficulty controlling Hazel who seems to be suffering from an overdose of sun, sea and sangria - to say nothing of gambling fever. Acclaimed comedy drama, starring Bill Paterson, Timothy Spall and Melanie Hill.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Barry finally announces his long-awaited wedding to Hazel is definitely going ahead and Oz secretly embarks on a romance of his own. Needless to say, Ally is concocting another dodgy scheme in the background and, as he puts it into operation, the lads sail off over the horizon. Comedy drama, starring Jimmy Nail, Timothy Spall and Tim Healy.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.sub-title: The Memory of Water - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The green-fingered amateur sleuths are drawn into another mystery when a barrister employing them to spruce up his garden discovers his cousin has been drowned, only for the man to be spotted alive and well a few days later. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.sub-title: The Memory of Water - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The amateur sleuths continue their investigation after Martin Frazer's cousin, who supposedly drowned, is spotted alive and well a few days later. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are enlisted to design a memorial garden based on the myth of Orpheus and Eurydice, but someone begins vandalising their work on a nightly basis. Matters are complicated still further by the death of a recovering alcoholic, whose body is found at the site. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris, with Phyllida Law, Joanna David and Daisy Dunlop.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The owner and curator of Brokenwood's Historic Village, Charity Highmore-Browne, dies after being struck by an arrow. Mike and his team delve into the realm of New Zealand's colonial past as they deal with suspects including a blacksmith, a missionary, the local postmaster and the victim's sister. Neill Rea stars.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When a man dies in a deliberately set fire, Murdoch's investigation into the aftermath reveals some shocking personal history.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A charity fundraiser who has travelled the country in a bath of baked beans is shot in a robbery, but his obsessive compulsive disorder gets on Gene's nerves, causing the DCI to beat a confession out of anyone who gets in his way. After the Clown warns Alex someone is going to die, she worries about Hunt's strong-arm tactics - and fights to keep control of the case. Matthew Macfadyen guest stars.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Alex realises there are just 24 hours until her parents die in a car bombing and chooses a horrified Ray to help her save them. Amid the chaos of a Gay Pride march, she arrests Tim and Caroline in the hope of keeping them safe, but with Lord Scarman due to visit the station a nervous Gene releases all the prisoners, aiming to make a good impression. Guest starring Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The parents of a teenage murder victim ask Kavanagh to pursue a private prosecution on their behalf and he promptly agrees, despite the fact they are unemployed and unable to pay a fee. The accused is related to a powerful local crook, and finding witnesses prepared to testify proves no easy task. John Thaw stars, with Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Fifteen-year-old Cassie Booth goes missing while doing her local paper round, and her blood-stained clothes are later found in a nearby boathouse owned by Karl Wilding. He is the prime suspect, but then seemingly helpful Stephen Warrington, a wine merchant who has initially brought a complaint about a house being used as a brothel, demonstrates too much interest in the case.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to Â£10,000. Rylan Clark-Neal asks the questions.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Can Danny handle the pressure of performing basketball tricks in front of hundreds of fans and avoid the messy forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: In the desert, Fizz and Weasel plan a fireworks display for Fizz. Mountain Rescuer Magoo mistakes Weasel for a skier in distress..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: In the forest, Magoo sets up camp by the rare fruit patch, giving a warm welcome to a bear that he has mistaken for a wayward hiker..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's a beach lifeguard but is actually on an ice floe and the swimmers are penguins..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket is selling up and moving on... but what will happen to Mr. Bean?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean takes on the Bruisers at the local skateboard park, using only a mobility scooter..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: During a tour of the Japanese Robotics Museum, Ben finds hero-gone-wrong Tim Buktu 'trying to save' Tokyo from a Dragon.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Dreadful Debacle of DJ Drowsy Drawers
programme.desc: George and Harold are trapped at the school dance, so they decide to play a prank on Ms Hurd..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Betty wants a nice photo of Dave and Anna, but the camera George uses happens to belong to Gran, and it's been cursed by an ancient mummy..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: If there were two things Dave could wish for it would be for Fuzzypeg to smell better, and for Gran to be nicer. Is getting what you want always a good thing?.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by friend and Michelin-starred chef Mark Jordan, riding around Jersey on mini motorbikes while exploring the island's culinary delights. James samples one of Jersey's most famous exports - the Jersey Royal potato - which he uses to cook up a squid risotto with a difference. Mark gets a lesson in oyster shucking and James uses Jersey black butter to create a black butter tartlet.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's tour of Sardinia continues in the Nuoro region, where his guide Claudio takes him to meet his parents, who run a small bakery specialising in pane carasau, a thin crispy bread found all over the island. Claudio then takes the chef to his family's citrus farm to discover local fruit the pompia, a citrus so bitter it is never eaten raw but makes a fabulous liqueur. Moving up to the hills, Ainsley cooks a traditional sheep stew with a group of shepherds, visits one of the island's ancient archaeological sites and cooks up a Sardinian-style minestrone.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make a chocolate cake out of leftover Easter eggs, and provide recipes for lamb fritters and scrambled eggs. Gino D'Acampo cooks seabass in Sardinia, Levi Roots makes spicy roast lamb, and The Great British Bake Off's Jane Beedle demonstrates cherry and pistachio tart.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.sub-title: Spirit of Queensland: Brisbane to Cairns
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones journeys from Brisbane to Cairns aboard the Spirit of Queensland railway - and during his various stops, he comes across all manner of things that seem determined to kill him, from jellyfish to dingoes to whitewater rapids and more.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a huge cash prize and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams make up the judging panel, looking for performers worthy of the Golden Buzzer and a slot in the semi-finals.

programme.title: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory (1971)
programme.desc: An eccentric confectionery king announces that five children will be given a tour of his wondrous factory. The winners turn out to be a kind-hearted boy from a penniless family and four obnoxious brats, who face a terrible fate when they misbehave. Musical fantasy, based on Roald Dahl's classic book Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, starring Gene Wilder, Jack Albertson, Peter Ostrum and Roy Kinnear.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Good Morning Britain host Kate Garraway, fashion presenter Gok Wan and former Mrs Brown's Boys star Rory Cowan to take part in the quiz show, answering questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of playing for the Â£20,000 jackpot prize.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Toyah Willcox, John Barnes, Germaine Greer and Audley Harrison pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Singer and presenter Charlotte Church, Pointless co-host Richard Osman and footballer-turned-pundit John Barnes take their turns at answering the 15 questions that could bag them Â£1million for their chosen charities. As always, if they get stuck, they have four lifelines to fall back on - Ask the Audience, 50/50, Phone a Friend and Ask the Host. Jeremy Clarkson asks the questions.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: Lydia tries to help a mysterious runaway teenager in the chaos of Diwali. Gabriel and Aisha bond over their past when they are thrown together in a clinic. Ted's search reveals new surprises about the mark he left on India and Jyoti discharges herself - but is she ready to go home? Medical drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Krishna Floyd, Priyanka Bose, Kenneth Cranham and Sayani Gupta.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: A revelation about Charles' past spells disaster for John and jeopardises his entire future. He must act fast to keep the explosive information hidden from those who could use it to ruin his prospects. Anne receives a visit from a former employee, giving Ellis an idea of how to make some money - but she is not as cunning as she thinks. Oliver visits the mill in his search for ammunition to use against Charles, and Lady Templemore stands firm on her plans for Maria's upcoming engagement, meaning the young woman must take matters into her own hands.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test
programme.desc: Cameras capture more would-be drivers as they sit their driving tests. Fifty-six-year-old Julie is desperate to pass on her third attempt, even though she has not driven in more than 24 years, while make-up artist Bradley serenades his driving examiner. In Hull, fiercely competitive father and daughter duo Rich and Yalana have their tests on the same day. Who will triumph? Narrated by Alan Carr.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: As the drama concludes, Roxanna is terrified by Alex's behaviour the previous night, and tries desperately to get to Alex before he confronts the money lenders. Meanwhile, Jill is still feeling shaken after witnessing Peter and Karen kissing and wonders if she should tell Maggie what has happened. As everyone gathers for the village celebrations, a sudden shocking series of events are put in motion that could potentially cost the life of one beloved villager. Starring Dawn French, Mark Heap and Gwyneth Keyworth.

programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team head to the Yorkshire Dales to surprise Jim Thompson, a terminally ill 65-year-old grandfather and fundraiser. Despite Jim's own diagnosis, his commitment to spreading awareness and raising money for prostate cancer charities are legendary in the area, including creating a Calendar Girls-style naked calendar. Inspired by his bravery and dedication, the makeover team decide to turn Jim's overgrown and dangerous plot into a classic cottage garden with a Yorkshire twist.

programme.title: Quiz
programme.desc: Major Charles Ingram doesn't like quizzes, but for his wife Diana and brother-in-law Adrian knowing the answer is a way of life. As Diana and Adrian's repeated attempts to get into the hotseat on Who Wants to Be a Millionare? fall short, all eyes turn to an unsuspecting Charles to win the million-pound prize. Meanwhile, the repeated reappearance of middle-class, professional quizzers has not gone unnoticed by the ITV team and producer Paul Smith makes a vow to stop them by any means necessary. Fact-based drama directed by Stephen Frears, starring Matthew Macfadyen, Sian Clifford and Mark Bonnar, with Michael Sheen as Chris Tarrant.

Next up is a trout fishing trip contest in the Colorado River, followed by a burger in Las Vegas with a hefty price tag of $777 and a visit to a ranch where they have to round up herds of cattle on horseback. Finally, they hit Los Angeles, where they have a barbecue battle.

programme.desc: The host interviews former Baywatch star and Playboy centrefold Pamela Anderson, who reflects on her career and turbulent personal life. She talks about her first husband Tommy Lee, whom she married following a whirlwind four-day courtship, and discusses the nature of her recent relationship with WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange. She also opens up about her role as an animal rights activist, including persuading Vladimir Putin to ban the import of seal products into Russia.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which five members of a running club answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: TV singers and vocal coaches Carrie and David Grant are today's VIP cooks, providing the food for Team Uniform - comprising a policeman, a vicar, a fireman and a midwife - who have to guess their identities with the help of a few cryptic clues. If the guests are successful, they will be one step closer to winning the full cash prize - but if they fail, they will be the ones doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Dino Dana
programme.desc: Dana and Grandma decide which one out of three dinosaurs would win in a fight, based on their size, strength, and various skills.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: After helping a new rebel group steal a shipment of Corvus weapons, Ariston is thrilled that the Freebot Fighters are inspiring others to join the revolution..

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Agent Danny finds out what it takes to man the controls of a cross-country locomotive when he spends the day as a train driver.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel are after the president's jokebook. But Magoo, thinking he's in his dojo, enters the high-security unit where it's kept....

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo's going to miss his flight. Unfortunately, he's not at the airport, but the supermarket, where Fizz and Weasel are hatching their latest plan..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.sub-title: The Prophecy of the Goldensand'S Dragon
programme.desc: Fizz is at the beach building a sandcastle. Magoo thinks they are preparing to thwart an attack by an enemy riding a dragon..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket becomes inconsolable when Scrapper goes missing. Mr. Bean investigates..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean has finished his model car collection, what next? What about football stickers?.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: During medieval times, Team Tennyson must fight to remember that they're not in the past at all, but actually at a Renaissance-esque faire.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave gets a girlfriend who turns out to be an alien. And she turns out to bear a striking similarity to an everyday household item..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Anna is practising for the school cycling test and is good at it. Dave isn't quite as skilled, but with a new bike from his parents he really hopes to pass..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by guests Roman Kemp and Vick Hope, and chefs Marcus Wareing and Jose Pizarro. Plus, Bettina Campolucci Bordi demonstrates some vegan recipes.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: The chef is joined by Paul Ainsworth to explore the culinary delights of Dorset, with the pair going aboard a millionaire's yacht, where James cooks a sea bass dish. Paul samples local cheeses, while James visits a breeder with Mangalitsa pigs in a beautiful coastline setting.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's tour of Sardinia continues in the Nuoro region, where his guide Claudio takes him to meet his parents, who run a small bakery specialising in pane carasau, a thin crispy bread found all over the island. Claudio then takes the chef to his family's citrus farm to discover local fruit the pompia, a citrus so bitter it is never eaten raw but makes a fabulous liqueur. Moving up to the hills, Ainsley cooks a traditional sheep stew with a group of shepherds, visits one of the island's ancient archaeological sites and cooks up a Sardinian-style minestrone.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team heads to the Yorkshire Dales to surprise Jim Thompson, a terminally ill 65-year-old grandfather and fundraiser. Despite Jim's own diagnosis, his commitment to spreading awareness and raising money for prostate cancer charities are legendary in the area, including creating a 'Calendar Girls' style naked calendar. Inspired by his bravery and dedication, the makeover team decide to turn Jim's overgrown and dangerous plot into a classic cottage garden with a Yorkshire twist.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute leads to murder after a stalwart in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe as Barnaby and Jones investigate. Guest starring Hugo Speer (Bleak House), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Ricky Wilson, Russell Kane and Chizzy Akudolu to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the Â£20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Sarah Willingham, Shaun Ryder, Michelle Dewberry and Eddie Edwards pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle course challenge, including weatherman Alex Beresford and former British Rugby player Maggie Alphonsi. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: In this edition, Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from Swansea, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to Â£1,000 in the big finale game.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win Â£250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: American television presenter Jerry Springer, Strictly Come Dancing co-host Tess Daly and presenter of dating game show Take Me Out Paddy McGuinness make up this week's panel as Keith Lemon noses around the homes of mystery stars, rummaging through their most treasured possessions. With the help of the studio audience, the panellists use clues highlighted along each tour to work out which famous faces have agreed to hand over their house keys to the Celebrity Juice funnyman.

programme.title: Crank (2006)
programme.desc: An assassin faces a race against time when he learns a rival has poisoned him with a drug that will kill him if his heart rate drops below a certain level. As he sets out to take revenge on his enemies, he has to resort to increasingly desperate acts to keep his adrenaline pumping. Action thriller, with Jason Statham, Amy Smart and Jose Pablo Cantillo.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to Â£10,000
